title: Boston meteorologists are ‘watching’ the track of a storm for Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists are monitoring a storm potentially affecting Boston on Monday, with low confidence in its track and impacts.
Computer models show mixed signals; the storm's path may bring snow or rain to New England on Presidents' Day.
Current predictions place the storm too far offshore for significant impact, but its path remains uncertain.

title: Kendrick Perkins explained why the Celtics are ‘the most dangerous team in the NBA’
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Kendrick Perkins views the Boston Celtics as the NBA's most dangerous team despite Jayson Tatum's absence.
Perkins cites Jaylen Brown as an MVP candidate, highlighting his scoring and defensive statistics.
Boston Celtics stand as a top-three Eastern Conference seed, exceeding expectations after offseason changes.

title: 4 State Police members relieved of duty as they face charges in recruit’s death
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Lt. Jennifer Penton and Troopers Edwin Rodriguez, David Montanez, and Casey LaMonte face manslaughter charges in Enrique Delgado-Garcia's death.
Delgado-Garcia died from injuries sustained in unauthorized, unsupervised boxing exercises at the Massachusetts State Police academy.
The officers could face varying disciplinary actions after duty status hearings; the incident prompted State Police training curriculum reforms.

title: High-end Italian marketplace, Greek restaurant, luxury shops to replace Neiman Marcus at Copley Place
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Neiman Marcus at Copley Place in Boston will be replaced by a high-end Italian marketplace, Greek restaurant, and luxury shops.
The new development includes Casa Tua Cucina, Estiatorio Milos, and boutiques like Dolce & Gabbana, FENDI, Tourneau, and LOEWE.
Construction on the new Copley Place project begins later this year with phased openings expected in 2028.

title: Boston was just named funniest city in the U.S. Is it?
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston named funniest city in the U.S. by TicketSource, surpassing cities like Minneapolis and Atlanta.
Boston's ranking credited to high comedy ticket demand, local comedians, and numerous comedy venues.
Boston topped the list with a comedy score of 8.17, ahead of Washington, D.C.'s score of 7.69.

title: Mass. snow totals by town: See who got the most from fast-moving overnight system
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Gloucester recorded the highest snow accumulation with six inches as of 7:30 a.m. on February 11, 2026.
Most cities and towns in Massachusetts received between 1 to 3 inches of snow from the overnight system.
The National Weather Service provided snow totals with Gloucester having the most snow accumulation overnight.

title: $8M South End penthouse in converted church has views of Prudential Center
author: Regina Cole
bullets: The $8 million penthouse is in a converted historic church in Boston's South End, at 201 W Brookline St.
Converted by developer Peter Zagorianakos, the building retains its historic exterior with a luxurious modern interior.
The 3,508-square-foot unit features a cupola with 360-degree views, three bedrooms, and elevator access to a heated garage.

title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 11)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Abington home sales include a raised ranch at 144 Helen Drive for $735,000 and a Colonial at 41 Clapp St. for $550,000.
Arlington features a one-family Colonial at 56 Valentine Road, built in 1950, sold for $2,100,000, featuring 8 rooms and 4 bedrooms.
Boston's highest sale was a one-family row-middle at 25 Upton St., built in 1861, with 16 rooms and sold for $4,035,000.

title: Hundreds of students displaced after burst pipe closes UMass Boston dorm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A burst sprinkler pipe on the 10th floor of East Residence Hall flooded 50 rooms, displacing UMass Boston students.
UMass Boston students expressed frustration over lack of information and alternative housing options after the flooding incident.
UMass Boston arranged temporary housing at UMass Amherst, with shuttles provided for displaced students from Boston.

title: Seattle Public Library schools the Boston Public Library with book recommendations for Patriots fans
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Seattle Public Library suggests over 35 Seattle-themed books to Boston Public Library after Patriots' Super Bowl loss.
Recommendations include titles like Michael Bennett's memoir and books on economic topics and Seattle's punk scene.
Both libraries participate in 'Books Unbanned,' promoting teens' literary freedom nationwide, despite football rivalry.
